paper_title.en: Fixed points of mappings of infinitely divisible distributions on R-d

description.en: A fixed point mu under a mapping Phi of infinitely divisible distributions on R-d is defined by the relation Phi(mu) = mu(a) * delta(c) for some a > 0 and c is an element of R-d. We investigate fixed points under some specific mappings, which are related to stable distributions. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Fixed points of mappings of infinitely divisible distributions on R-d

description.en: A fixed point mu under a mapping Phi of infinitely divisible distributions on R-d is defined by the relation Phi(mu) = mu(a) * delta(c) for some a > 0 and c is an element of R-d. We investigate fixed points under some specific mappings, which are related to stable distributions. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: A new family of mappings of infinitely divisible distributions related to the Goldie-Steutel-Bondesson class

description.en: Let {X(t)((mu)), t >= 0} be a Levy process on R(d) whose distribution at time 1 is a d-dimensional infinitely distribution mu. It is known that the set of all infinitely divisible distributions on R(d), each of which is represented by the law of a stochastic integral integral(1)(0) log1/tdX(t)((mu)) for some infinitely divisible distribution on R(d), coincides with the Goldie-Steutel-Bondesson class, which, in one dimension, is the smallest class that contains all mixtures of exponential distributions and is closed under convolution and weak convergence. The purpose of this paper is to study the class of infinitely divisible distributions which are represented as the law of integral(1)(0) (log1/t)(1/alpha) dX(t)((mu)) for general alpha > 0. These stochastic integrals define a new family of mappings of infinitely divisible distributions. We first study properties of these mappings and their ranges. Then we characterize some subclasses of the range by stochastic integrals with respect to some compound Poisson processes. Finally, we investigate the limit of the ranges of the iterated mappings.

paper_title.en: A new family of mappings of infinitely divisible distributions related to the Goldie-Steutel-Bondesson class

description.en: Let {X(t)((mu)), t >= 0} be a Levy process on R(d) whose distribution at time 1 is a d-dimensional infinitely distribution mu. It is known that the set of all infinitely divisible distributions on R(d), each of which is represented by the law of a stochastic integral integral(1)(0) log1/tdX(t)((mu)) for some infinitely divisible distribution on R(d), coincides with the Goldie-Steutel-Bondesson class, which, in one dimension, is the smallest class that contains all mixtures of exponential distributions and is closed under convolution and weak convergence. The purpose of this paper is to study the class of infinitely divisible distributions which are represented as the law of integral(1)(0) (log1/t)(1/alpha) dX(t)((mu)) for general alpha > 0. These stochastic integrals define a new family of mappings of infinitely divisible distributions. We first study properties of these mappings and their ranges. Then we characterize some subclasses of the range by stochastic integrals with respect to some compound Poisson processes. Finally, we investigate the limit of the ranges of the iterated mappings.

paper_title.en: COMPOSITIONS OF MAPPINGS OF INFINITELY DIVISIBLE DISTRIBUTIONS WITH APPLICATIONS TO FINDING THE LIMITS OF SOME NESTED SUBCLASSES

description.en: Let {X(t)((mu)), t >= 0} be a Levy process on R(d) whose distribution at time 1 is mu, and let f be a nonrandom measurable function on (0,a), 0 < a <= infinity. The we can define a mapping Phi(f)(mu) by the law of integral(a)(0)f(t)dX(t)((mu)), from D(Phi(f)) which is the totality of mu is an element of I(R(d)) such that the stochastic integral integral(a)(0)f(t)dX(t)((mu)) is definable, into a class of infinitely divisible distributions. For m is an element of N, let Phi(m)(f) be the m times compostion of Phi(f) itself. Maejima and sato (2009) proved that the limits boolean AND(infinity)(m=1)Phi(m)(f)(D(Phi(m)(f))) are the same for several known f's. Maejima and Nakhara (2009) introduced more general f's. In this paper, the limits boolean AND(infinity)(m=1)Phi(m)(f)(D(Phi(m)(f))) for such general f's are investigated by using the idea of compositions of suitable mappings of infinitely divisible distributions.

paper_title.en: COMPOSITIONS OF MAPPINGS OF INFINITELY DIVISIBLE DISTRIBUTIONS WITH APPLICATIONS TO FINDING THE LIMITS OF SOME NESTED SUBCLASSES

description.en: Let {X(t)((mu)), t >= 0} be a Levy process on R(d) whose distribution at time 1 is mu, and let f be a nonrandom measurable function on (0,a), 0 < a <= infinity. The we can define a mapping Phi(f)(mu) by the law of integral(a)(0)f(t)dX(t)((mu)), from D(Phi(f)) which is the totality of mu is an element of I(R(d)) such that the stochastic integral integral(a)(0)f(t)dX(t)((mu)) is definable, into a class of infinitely divisible distributions. For m is an element of N, let Phi(m)(f) be the m times compostion of Phi(f) itself. Maejima and sato (2009) proved that the limits boolean AND(infinity)(m=1)Phi(m)(f)(D(Phi(m)(f))) are the same for several known f's. Maejima and Nakhara (2009) introduced more general f's. In this paper, the limits boolean AND(infinity)(m=1)Phi(m)(f)(D(Phi(m)(f))) for such general f's are investigated by using the idea of compositions of suitable mappings of infinitely divisible distributions.

paper_title.en: The limits of nested subclasses of several classes of infinitely divisible distributions are identical with the closure of the class of stable distributions

description.en: It is shown that the limits of the nested subclasses of five classes of infinitely divisible distributions on R(d), which are the Jurek class, the Goldie-Steutel-Bondesson class, the class of selfdecomposable distributions, the Thorin class and the class of generalized type G distributions, are identical with the closure of the class of stable distributions. More general results are also given.

paper_title.en: The limits of nested subclasses of several classes of infinitely divisible distributions are identical with the closure of the class of stable distributions

description.en: It is shown that the limits of the nested subclasses of five classes of infinitely divisible distributions on R(d), which are the Jurek class, the Goldie-Steutel-Bondesson class, the class of selfdecomposable distributions, the Thorin class and the class of generalized type G distributions, are identical with the closure of the class of stable distributions. More general results are also given.

paper_title.ja: A note on new classes of infinitely divisible distributions on R^d
Stochastic integral characterizations of semi-selfdecomposable distributions and related Ornstein-Uhlenbeck type processes

paper_title.en: A note on new classes of infinitely divisible distributions on R^d
Stochastic integral characterizations of semi-selfdecomposable distributions and related Ornstein-Uhlenbeck type processes

description.en: Upsilon transformations satisfying certain regularity conditions are shown to generate semigroups of such transformations. This is based on a general commutativity property of the Upsilon transformations, and uses log infinite divisibility. The existence of random integral representations of Upsilon transformations and of the generated semigroups is also discussed. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Upsilon transformations satisfying certain regularity conditions are shown to generate semigroups of such transformations. This is based on a general commutativity property of the Upsilon transformations, and uses log infinite divisibility. The existence of random integral representations of Upsilon transformations and of the generated semigroups is also discussed. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: A subclass of type G selfdecomposable distributions on R-d

description.en: A new class of type G selfdecomposable distributions on R-d is introduced and characterized in terms of stochastic integrals with respect to Levy processes. This class is a strict subclass of the class of type G and selfdecomposable distributions, and in dimension one, it is strictly bigger than the class of variance mixtures of normal distributions by selfdecomposable distributions. The relation to several other known classes of infinitely divisible distributions is established.

paper_title.en: Limit theorems for weighted sums of infinite variance random variables attracted to integrals of linear fractional stable motions

description.en: Let (ξj)j∈Z be a sequence of random variables which belong to the domain of attraction of a linear fractional stable motion (ΔH,α(t)) with infinite variance. We study the convergence of weighted sums In(f):= Anj∈Z f (j/n)ξj with a suitable scaling An, to I (f):= image f (u)dΔH,α(u) in distribution under suitable assumptions on a class of deterministic functions f . We also show that if (ft, t ≥ 0) are the kernel functions from the “moving average” representation of a linear fractional stable motion with another index H’, then (In(ft)) converges to a linear fractional stable motion (ΔH+H’−1/α,α(t)). © 2008 International Academic Printing Co. Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: A subclass of type G selfdecomposable distributions

paper_title.en: Limit theorems for weighted sums of infinite variance random variables attracted to integrals of linear fractional stable motions

description.en: Let (ξj)j∈Z be a sequence of random variables which belong to the domain of attraction of a linear fractional stable motion (ΔH,α(t)) with infinite variance. We study the convergence of weighted sums In(f):= Anj∈Z f (j/n)ξj with a suitable scaling An, to I (f):= image f (u)dΔH,α(u) in distribution under suitable assumptions on a class of deterministic functions f . We also show that if (ft, t ≥ 0) are the kernel functions from the “moving average” representation of a linear fractional stable motion with another index H’, then (In(ft)) converges to a linear fractional stable motion (ΔH+H’−1/α,α(t)). © 2008 International Academic Printing Co. Ltd. All rights reserved.

work_title.ja: 学部１年生の数学について、将来数学系に進む可能性の高い学生のクラスを担当。他のクラスとは全く違った理念に基づく教科書（プリントの冊子）を同僚と協力して作成。将来慶應大学理工学部の高学年で困ることのないように配慮した教育を実践中。
学部１年生の数学（必修科目）教材についての、既存のものを使わずに、慶應大学理工学部の教育理念に合った独自の教科書を同僚と編纂、毎年内容の見直しを行いながらヴァージョンアップして使用した。
大学院「数理ファイナンス」の講義を、理工学研究科における、ファイナンスという経済現象の解説に適するように、２限続きの講義とし、１限はデータ解析の専門家による現実問題の直視、２限は確率論専門家（私）による数学的補強という形をとっている。用意した教室から学生が溢れるほどの反響がある。
講義担当においては常に、１．学生が授業中に質問しやすい環境を作る、２．授業時間以外の質問についても、研究室訪問、メールでの質問をしやすい環境を作る、３．講義の目的目標が学生に理解できるようにガイダンスを工夫する、４．成績評価に学生が疑問を持たないように、評価方法を公開して公正を保つ、等を心掛けている。
